text.p: Suppose you do some row operations to an augmented matrix, and the result is the following augmented matrix:
How many free variables are there?
What can you conclude about the original system of equations?

choice.text: The system is consistent and has a unique solution
The system is consistent but has more than one solution

font.p: The original system corresponds to 3 equations in 4 variables. Since there are 2 pivot positions in the RREF, there are [mathjaxinline]4-2=2[/mathjaxinline] free variables. Since there is no row of zeros followed by a non-zero entry, the system is consistent, but the existence of free variables ensures that any solution to the system is not unique.
